inline xbrl viewer application relies heavily javascript need allow javascript to use this application inline viewer menu menu information save xbrl instance save xbrl zip file open html setting help section section additional search option include fact name include fact content include label include definition include dimension reference option include topic include sub topic include paragraph include publisher include section match case clear search submit search data data amount text only calculation only negative only additional item only tag tag all standard only custom only filter more filter selecting will take moment period measure axis explicit typed member explicit typed scale balance debit credit reset all filter link fact inline xbrl html form performance may affected using google chrome help alleviate of performance issue loading inline form tagged section search all search in internal section only search in external section only clear section search submit section search help getting started the inline xbrl viewer allows user to quickly easily review detail of the tagged information in inline document automatically placing top and bottom highlight border around tagged numeric fact and left and right border each block tagged fact hovering over tagged fact will highlight shade all content related to the tagged fact and clicking on tagged fact will reveal tagging detail in the fact review window navigation search and filter option also provided to easily refine and identify specific type of tagged information fact review window the fact review window show the tagging detail for the currently selected fact is highlighted solid blue border are four category of fact detail which can be viewed an value indicates there is available information for the item within the given category attribute all primary information applicable describing the tagged fact including period sign decimal dimensional detail ax and member scale measure and data type label detailed documentation definition for the tag used and label reference authoritative reference information applicable for the selected tag calculation balance and calculation hierarchy detail numeric non dimensioned item only searching there are two way to search the document fact and section to search information enter keyword in search box and select the magnifying glass icon to return matching result search operator and via and and or via or or are available to refine search fact the search fact box can be used to find tagged fact matching entered keywords by default tag name tag label and tagged content are included in search tagged fact matching the search criterion are shown with yellow colored default shading on the page and appear in the fact list select the button to the left of the magnifying glass icon to clear the search the content included in search can be increased to included tag definition dimension and authoritative reference by selecting the cog wheel icon to the left of the search box see setting for more information section the search section box can be used to filter the tagged section of the financial statement filter filter change the number of highlighted fact and item in the fact list by providing several way to review and pinpoint certain tagged information multiple filter can be used data filter these filter option allow the user to refine the highlighted tagged fact by data type all display all tagged data default amount only numeric fact only text only textual fact only calculation only numeric fact participating in calculation only negative only negative numeric amount only additional item only tagged fact without corresponding html presentation hidden fact only tag filter these filter allow the user to refine the highlighted fact by tag type all display all tagged data default standard only fact with standard tag common taxonomy us_gaap ifrs dei custom only fact with extension custom tag unique to the entity document more filter additional filter allow user to further refine the highlighted fact period list of all used context year and reporting period measure list of all used unit of measure dollar applicable axis list of all used axis dimension applicable dimension applicable scale list of all used scaled option thousand million applicable balance debit credit applicable multiple filter work in conjunction with each other for example selecting the amount only data filter and custom only tag filter will highlight only numeric tagged fact using custom tag and list in the fact list active filter are displayed in the filter toolbar are selected active filter can be removed individually by unchecking or selecting all option for each filter or all at once via the reset all filter option fact list result on the toolbar select the count to the right of the word fact fact to reveal the fact list result navigable listing of all currently highlighted tagged fact the count represents the current number of fact by default all tagged fact are displayed in the fact list result the list content and count reflects the currently highlighted fact filter and search criterion refine the list to match the highlighted tagged fact navigation control are available to move the list well move the current view to the corresponding highlighted fact location automatically fact in the fact result list is selected will reveal the fact review window certain letter may appear to the right of an item in the fact result list to indicate certain property the letter appears for fact it indicates the fact is additional data hidden with potentially no corresponding html presentation if the letter appears the fact is tagged with custom tag if the letter appears the fact is tagged with dimensional information section the section toolbar item provides listing of the tagged section of the inline document section are divided three group document entity information financial statement note to the financial statement by expanding group and selecting section item in the listing inline xbrl viewer will navigate to that section when the tagged section feature is open the search section box will additionally filter the list of section to only section that match the entered criterion menu information the information menu item provides additional detail the current inline document and customizable viewer setting company and document basic company and document information tag fact and tag standard and custom information file file used additional item additional hidden data that tagged potentially corresponding location in the html save xbrl instance the save xbrl instance menu item allows an xbrl instance document xml that is extracted from the inline document to be saved locally for use by software supporting the xbrl format save xbrl zip the save xbrl zip menu item allows zip file zip that contains the provided xbrl instance document and related custom taxonomy file to be saved locally setting the setting menu item provides the ability to customize viewer feature tagged fact hover on display the hover fact review window for any tagged fact hide the hover fact review window for any tagged fact default may impact performance with certain web browser auto scrolling position this setting will have no effect on ie or safari top selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the top of the inline xbrl viewer window default center selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the middle of the inline xbrl viewer window highlight color use the save and reset button to save the selected setting or reset to default tagged data change the highlight color of the tagged fact border search result change the background color of tagged item matching the search result selected fact change the color of highlight border used to identify the currently selected fact tag shading hover change the color of the shading applied to tagged data on hover search option match case match the specific case of the entered search keyword include label extends search to include tag label include definition extends search to include tag definition include dimension extends search to include dimensional detail include reference extends search to include authoritative reference information optionally specify the reference part to include in the search topic subtopic section help this content version indicates the current build of the inline xbrl viewer application fact word and term of similar meaning or that are otherwise tied to future period or future performance in each case in all derivative form they include statement relating to future action prospective operation and financial result many factor determine company result and they involve unpredictable risk and uncertainty our forward looking statement depend on our assumption our expectation and our understanding of the economic environment but they may be inaccurate and may change we do not guarantee any future performance our result could differ materially from those we express or imply in asset management we hold leading market position in the united state japan latin america asia europe and the middle east we are also one of the largest institutional investor in the with general limited partnership and equity security our well recognized brand globally diversified and market leading business competitive and innovative product offering and financial strength and expertise should help drive future growth and enhance shareholder value we will continue to execute on our next horizon strategy creating value focusing on the following three pillar focus generate strong free cash flow by deploying capital and resource to the highest value opportunity simplify simplify our business to deliver operational efficiency and an outstanding customer experience differentiate drive competitive advantage through our brand scale talent and innovation metlife is organized into five segment asia latin america europe the middle east and africa emea and metlife holding in addition the the death of the insured for specified time period in return for the periodic payment of premium premium may be guaranteed at level amount for the coverage period or may be non level and non guaranteed term contract expire without value at the end of the coverage period when the insured party is still living variable life insuranceinsurance coverage through contract that give the policyholder flexibility in investment choice and depending on the product in premium payment and coverage amount with certain guarantee premium and account balance can be directed by the policyholder into variety of separate account investment option or directed to the company general account in the separate account investment option the policyholder bear the entire risk of the investment result with some product by maintaining certain premium level policyholder may have the advantage of various guarantee that may protect the death benefit from adverse investment experience universal life insuranceinsurance coverage on the basis variable life except that premium and the resulting accumulated balance are allocated only to the company general account with some product by maintaining certain premium level policyholder may have the advantage of various guarantee that may protect the death benefit from adverse investment experience dental insurance and aso arrangement that assist employee retiree and their family in maintaining oral health reducing of pocket expense disability insurance and aso arrangement for group and individual to provide benefit for income replacement payment of business overhead expense or mortgage protection in the event of the disability of the insured accident health insuranceaccident critical illness or hospital indemnity coverage to the insured vision insurance aso arrangement and managed eye health and vision care solution to assist employee retiree and their family in maintaining vision health while reducing out of pocket expense offered to commercial group individual health plan and government sponsored program through nationwide provider network retail optical chain and online eyewear provider retirement and income solution our ri business provides funding and financing solution that help institutional customer mitigate and manage liability primarily associated with their employee benefit program using spectrum of life and annuity based insurance and investment product we distribute ri product and service through dedicated sale team and relationship manager primarily comprised of metlife employee we may sell product directly to benefit plan sponsor and advisor or through broker consultant or other intermediary in addition these sale professional work with individual group and global distribution area to better reach and service customer broker consultant and other intermediary major productsstable value product general account guaranteed interest contract gics are designed to provide stable value investment option within tax qualified defined contribution plan by offering fixed maturity investment with guarantee of liquidity at contract value for participant transaction separate account gics are available to defined contribution plan sponsor by offering market value return on separate account investment with general account guarantee that plan participant will always be able to transact in their account at contract value synthetic gics or wrap are contract available only to the sponsor of participant directed defined contribution plan the contract wrap portfolio of investment owned by the plan to provide guarantee that plan participant will always be able to transact in their account at contract value generally wrap contract mean that participant will not experience negative return private floating rate funding agreement are generally privately placed unregistered investment contract issued general account obligation with interest credited based on specified rate or agreed upon short term benchmark rate these agreement are used for money market fund security lending cash collateral portfolio and short term investment fund of contentsannuitiespension risk transfersgeneral account and separate account annuity are offered in connection with defined benefit pension plan which include single premium buyout allowing for full or partial transfer of pension liability general account annuity include nonparticipating group contract benefit purchased for retired employee or active employee covered under terminating or ongoing pension plan separate account annuity include both participating and non participating group contract benefit participating contract benefit are purchased for retired terminated or active employee covered under active or terminated pension plan the asset supporting the guaranteed benefit for each contract are held in separate account however the company fully guarantee all benefit payment non participating contract have economic feature similar to our general account product but offer the added protection of an insulated separate account under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america gaap these annuity contract are treated general account product institutional income annuitiesgeneral account contract that are guaranteed payout annuity purchased for employee upon retirement or termination of employment contract can be life or non life contingent non participating contract which do not provide for any loan or cash surrender value and with few exception do not permit future consideration structured settlementscustomized annuity designed to serve an alternative to lump sum payment in lawsuit initiated of personal injury wrongful death or worker compensation claim or other claim for damage surrender are generally not allowed although commutation are permitted in certain circumstance guaranteed payment consist of life contingent annuity term certain annuity and lump sum risk solutionslongevity reinsurance solutionslongevity reinsurance is risk mitigation solution for united kingdom pension plan sponsor and insurance company that write pension risk transfer business converting uncertain future pension benefit obligation into fixed stream of payment to metlife over the duration of the contract opposed to lump sum at inception in typical pension risk transfer transaction benefit funding solutionsspecialized life insurance product and funding agreement designed specifically to provide solution for funding postretirement benefit and company bank or trust owned life insurance used to finance nonqualified benefit program for executive capital market investment product funding agreement backed note are offered in medium term note program under which funding agreement are issued to special purpose trust that issue marketable note in dollar or foreign currency the proceeds of these note issuance are used to acquire funding agreement with matching interest and maturity payment term from certain subsidiary of metlife inc the note are underwritten and marketed by major investment bank broker dealer operation and are sold to institutional investor company mlic the commercial paper is issued in dollar or foreign currency receives the same short term credit rating mlic and is marketed by major investment bank broker dealer operation funding productsvariable universal and term life insurancesimilar to product offered by our group benefit business except that these product were historically marketed to individual through various retail distribution channel for description of these product see group benefit whole life insurancea benefit upon the death of the insured in return for the periodic payment of fixed premium over predetermined period whole life insurance includes policy that provide participation feature in the form of dividend policyholder may receive dividend in cash or apply them to increase death benefit increase cash value available upon surrender or reduce the premium required to maintain the contract in force variable annuity variable annuity provide for asset accumulation and asset distribution need variable annuity allow the contractholder to allocate deposit into various investment option in separate account determined by the contractholder in certain variable annuity product contractholders may also choose to allocate all or portion of their account to the company general account and are credited with interest at rate we determine subject to specified minimum contractholders may also elect certain minimum death benefit and minimum living benefit guarantee for which additional fee are charged and asset allocation restriction may apply fixed and indexed linked annuitiesfixed annuity provide for asset accumulation and asset distribution need deposit made into deferred annuity contract are allocated to the company general account and are credited with interest at rate we determine subject to specified minimum fixed income annuity provide guaranteed monthly income for specified period of year and or for the life of the annuitant additionally the company ha issued indexed linked annuity which allow the contractholder to participate in return from equity index long term care protection the potentially high cost of long term health care service generally pay benefit to insured need assistance with activity of daily living or have cognitive impairment corporate other corporate other contains various start developing and run off business also institutional investor worldwide of contentspolicyholder liabilitieswe establish and carry liability actuarially determined amount that are calculated to meet policy obligation when policy matures or is surrendered an insured dy or becomes disabled or upon the occurrence of other covered event or to provide for future annuity payment our liability for future policy benefit and claim are established based on estimate by actuary of much we will need to pay for future benefit and claim for life insurance and annuity product we calculate these liability based on assumption and estimate including estimated premium to be received over the assumed life of the policy the timing of the event covered by the insurance policy and the amount of benefit or claim to be paid we establish liability for claim and benefit based on assumption and estimate of loss and liability incurred amount for actuarial liability are computed and reported on the consolidated financial statement in conformity with gaap for more detail on policyholder liability see management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation summary of critical accounting estimate liability for future policy benefit and management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation policyholder liability metlife inc insurance subsidiary including affiliated captive reinsurers establish statutory reserve under method prescribed by the insurance law of their respective domiciliary jurisdiction these reserve are reported liability and we expect them to be sufficient to meet policy and contract obligation when taken together with expected future premium and interest at assumed rate statutory reserve and actuarial liability for future policy benefit reported under gaap generally differ due to the difference in accounting requirement state insurance law and regulation require certain metlife entity to submit an annual opinion and memorandum of qualified actuary in it the qualified actuary state that the statutory reserve and related actuarial amount recorded in support of specified policy and contract and the asset supporting such statutory reserve and related actuarial amount adequately provide for the anticipated cash flow required to meet contractual obligation and related expense insurance regulator in many of the non jurisdiction in which we operate require certain metlife entity to prepare and submit sufficiency analysis of the reserve presented in the locally required regulatory financial statement see regulation insurance regulation policy and contract reserve adequacy analysis underwriting and pricing we use variety of underwriting and pricing management control our global risk management department develops product pricing standard and oversees underwriting practice in metlife insurance business we also regularly conduct experience study to monitor assumption against expectation impose formal new product approval process periodically update product profitability study and use reinsurance to manage our exposure appropriate see reinsurance activity underwritingour underwriter and actuary use detailed underwriting policy guideline and procedure to ass and quantify insurance risk and determine the type and the amount of risk we are willing to accept insurance underwriter consider an applicant medical history and other factor such financial profile foreign travel vocation and alcohol drug and tobacco use group insurance underwriter generally evaluate the risk characteristic of the prospective insured group but may underwrite member of group on an individual basis for certain voluntary product and coverage our employee generally perform our underwriting but intermediary review certain policy under guideline established by generally we are not obligated to accept any risk or group of risk from or to issue policy or group of policy to any employer or intermediary we review request for coverage on their merit and issue policy only after we have examined and approved the particular risk or group under our underwriting guideline we periodically review all our underwriting to maintain high standard of quality and consistency our reinsurers generally have the right to audit our underwriting we use underwriting policy guideline philosophy and strategy that we intend to be competitive and suitable for the customer the agent and to facilitate quality sale and to serve our customer need while supporting our financial strength and business objective we aim to ensure that underwriting risk level are appropriately reflected in our product pricing we continually review our underwriting policy guideline philosophy and strategy in light of applicable regulation and to ensure that our policy remain competitive support our marketing strategy and profitability goal and otherwise remain appropriate of contentspricingproduct pricing reflects our globally consistent standard global risk management and regional finance and product team price and oversee all of our insurance business we base our pricing on the expected benefit payout which we calculate through the use of assumption for mortality morbidity expense persistency and investment return and macroeconomic factor such inflation we price investment oriented product based on factor such investment return expense persistency optionality and possible variability of result our pricing of certain product may include prospective and retrospective experience rating feature for prospective experience rating we evaluate past experience to determine future premium rate and we bear all prior year gain and loss for retrospective experience rating we evaluate past experience to determine our cost of providing insurance for the customer in light of any feature that allow to recoup certain loss or distribute certain gain back to the policyholder based on prior year experience we base our rate for group benefit product on anticipated earnings and expense for the book of business we generally evaluate renewal annually or biannually and re price product to reflect our experience on such product we generally price many of our ri product on demand our pricing reflects our expected investment return well mortality longevity and expense assumption ri business is generally nonparticipating and illiquid policyholder have few or no option or contractual right to cash value however for product with liquidity provision such stable value pricing reflects the contractholders ability to withdraw at book value over period of time well our ability to reset rate periodically we generally must receive regulatory approval of rate for individual life insurance product such rate are highly regulated even where we are not required to obtain advance regulatory approval we generally renew such product annually and they may include pricing term that are guaranteed for certain period of time we price individual disability income product based on anticipated result by occupation our rate for fixed and variable annuity product are also highly regulated and we also generally must receive regulatory approval of them such product generally include penalty for early withdrawal and policyholder benefit election to tailor benefit to policyholder need we periodically reevaluate the cost of such option and adjust pricing level on our guarantee we may also reevaluate the type and level of guarantee feature we offer we continually review our pricing guideline in light of applicable regulation and to ensure that our policy remain competitive support our marketing strategy and profitability goal and otherwise remain appropriate reinsurance activitywe enter into reinsurance agreement primarily purchaser of reinsurance for our various insurance product we also provide reinsurance for some third party insurance product we participate in reinsurance in order to limit loss minimize exposure to significant risk and provide additional capacity for future growth our reinsurance cover individual risk group risk or defined block of business primarily on coinsurance yearly renewable term excess or catastrophe excess basis the extent of our retained risk depends on our risk evaluation subject in certain circumstance to maximum retention limit based on our risk appetite we also cede first dollar mortality risk under certain contract we reinsure both mortality and other risk we obtain reinsurance for capital requirement purpose and when it economic impact make it appropriate to do so we also reinsure for risk and capital management purpose among affiliate including affiliated captive reinsurers and affiliated offshore insurance company captive reinsurers are affiliated insurance company licensed such under the special purpose financial captive law adopted by several state including vermont and south carolina captive insurer very narrow business plan restrict most or all of their activity to reinsuring business from their affiliate see management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation liquidity and capital resource the company capital affiliated captive reinsurance transaction for information regarding reinsurance by segment our catastrophic coverage and ceded reinsurance recoverable balance included in premium reinsurance and environment and change in law in the jurisdiction in which we operate could materially harm our result of operation insurance regulationinsurance regulation generally aim to protect policyholder and ensure insurance company solvency insurance regulator increasingly seek information about the potential impact of activity on holding company system whole and some jurisdiction have asserted group commissioner regarding group wide supervision each of metlife insurance subsidiary is licensed and regulated in each jurisdiction where it conduct insurance business the extent of insurance regulation in such jurisdiction varies but most jurisdiction regulate the financial aspect and business conduct of insurer through broad administrative power with respect to among other thing licensing company and agent to transact business calculating the value of asset to determine compliance with statutory requirement mandating certain insurance benefit regulating certain premium rate reviewing and approving certain policy form including required policyholder disclosure regulating unfair trade and claim practice including through the imposition of restriction on marketing and sale practice specifying the condition under which ceding company can take credit for reinsurance in it statutory financial statement reduce it reserve by the amount of reserve ceded to reinsurer fixing maximum interest rate on insurance policy loan and minimum guaranteed crediting rate on life insurance policy and annuity contract adopting and enforcing standard with respect to the sale of annuity and other insurance product approving change in control of insurance company restricting the payment of dividend and other transaction affiliate and regulating the type and amount of investment of contentseach also periodically examine it operation and account these subsidiary must also file and in many jurisdiction and in some line of insurance obtain regulatory approval of rate and policy form relating to note to the consolidated financial statement federal initiativesu federal initiative can affect our business in variety of way including regulation of financial service security derivative pension health care money laundering foreign sanction and corrupt practice and taxation for instance legislator and policymakers have proposed various form of direct and indirect federal regulation of insurance from time to time such proposal for the establishment of an optional federal charter for insurance company see risk factor regulatory and legal risk change in law or regulation or in supervisory and enforcement policy may reduce our profitability limit our growth or otherwise adversely affect the inflation reduction act signed into law by president biden on august included number of tax related provision such fifteen percent alternative minimum tax rate on adjusted financial statement income and ii one percent excise tax on certain corporate stock buyback both provision became effective on january and are not expected to have material impact on our result of operation the dodd frank wall street reform and consumer protection act dodd frank increased the potential federal role in regulating business such including in the following way the financial stability oversight council may designate certain financial company non bank systemically important financial institution non bank sifi subject to supervision by the board of governor of the federal reserve system federal reserve board and the federal reserve bank of new york collectively with the federal reserve board the federal reserve the federal insurance office fio within the department of the treasury may participate in the negotiation of international insurance agreement with foreign regulator for the collect information about the insurance industry and recommend prudential standard if an insurance holding company such metlife inc or another non insurance financial institution were to become insolvent or were in danger of defaulting on it obligation and regulator determined that this would have serious adverse effect on financial stability in the the federal deposit insurance corporation fdic may liquidate such company receiver in that case the bankruptcy code which ordinarily governs liquidation would not apply the fdic purpose would be to mitigate the systemic risk the institution failure pose this is different objective from that of bankruptcy trustee under the bankruptcy code in such liquidation the holder of such company debt could in certain respect be treated differently than under the bankruptcy code the fdic ha established rule relating to the priority of creditor claim and the potentially dissimilar treatment of similarly situated creditor these provision could apply to some financial institution whose outstanding debt security we hold in our investment portfolio however state insurance law would continue to apply to an insurance company resolution dodd frank provision may also affect the investment and investment activity of metlife inc and it subsidiary including imposing federal regulation of such activity dodd frank and it implementing regulation have changed since the law wa adopted result of these change and potential change we can not identify all the risk posed and opportunity presented if any to our business see risk factor regulatory and legal risk change in law or regulation or in supervisory and enforcement policy may reduce our profitability limit our growth or otherwise adversely affect january the mccarran ferguson act largely exempted insurance from antitrust law however the competitive health insurance reform act amended the mccarran ferguson act such that antitrust law apply to the business of health insurance and regulatory authority expanded accordingly we expect regulatory oversight and litigation risk for product including dental and vision to increase of contentshealth care regulationthe excise tax known the health insurer fee wa in force for the calendar year the health insurer fee no longer applies for calendar year beginning after december however demand for and pricing of product remain subject to tax uncertainty federal health care statute and related regulation have imposed increased and unpredictable cost on certain product and may have additional adverse effect they have also harmed our competitive position these rule have disparate impact on our product compared to product offered by our not for profit competitor see risk factor regulatory and legal risk change in law or regulation or in supervisory and enforcement policy may reduce our profitability limit our growth or otherwise adversely affect guaranty association and similar arrangementsmany jurisdiction in which our insurance subsidiary transact business require life and health insurer to participate in guaranty or similar association these arrangement pay certain insurance benefit owed by impaired insolvent or failed insurer guaranty association levy assessment up to prescribed limit on all member insurer in particular jurisdiction on the basis of the proportionate share of the premium written by member insurer in the line of business in which the impaired insolvent or failed insurer engaged in addition certain jurisdiction have government owned or controlled organization providing life and health insurance to their citizen whose activity could place additional stress on the adequacy of guaranty fund assessment many of these organization have the power to levy assessment similar to those of the guaranty association some jurisdiction permit member insurer to recover assessment paid through full or partial premium tax offset we have established liability for guaranty fund assessment that we consider adequate insurance regulatory examination and other activitiesu state insurance department periodically examine the book record account and business practice of their domiciled insurer state insurance department may also conduct examination of non domiciliary insurer licensed in their state in metlife entered into consent order with the new york state department of financial service nydfs relating to unclaimed property following an open market conduct quinquennial exam under which it paid fine and customer restitution and submitted remediation plan for approval except for this consent order or described in note of the note to the consolidated financial statement during the year ended december and metlife not receive any material adverse finding resulting from state insurance department examination of it insurance subsidiary regulatory authority in small number of state the financial industry regulatory authority finra and occasionally the security and exchange commission often focus on the conduct and or supervision of particular financial service representative the sale of unregistered or unsuitable product the misuse of client asset or sale and replacement of annuity and certain rider on such annuity in and finra conducted routine examination of two of our broker dealer affiliate and there were no material adverse finding over the past several year we investigation and action on these matter in similar manner insurance standard setting and regulatory support organization including the naic encourage insurance supervisor to establish supervisory college these organization facilitate cooperation and coordination among insurance supervisor to enhance their understanding of the risk profile of based insurance group with international operation metlife lead state regulator the nydfs annually chair supervisory college meeting that metlife key and non regulator attend regulator supervise our non insurance and pension business through periodic examination of insurance company book and record financial reporting requirement market conduct examination and policy filing requirement the european insurance and occupational pension authority european operation including metlife these forum facilitate cooperation and coordination among european supervisor to enhance their understanding of an insurance group risk profile in addition regulator have scrutinized insurer claim payment practice see note of the note to the consolidated financial statement for further information regarding group annuity benefit and unclaimed property inquiry of contentspolicy and contract reserve adequacy analysisour insurance subsidiary including affiliated captive reinsurers must annually analyze their statutory reserve adequacy in each case qualified actuary must submit an opinion that state that the statutory reserve make adequate provision according to accepted actuarial standard of practice for the anticipated cash flow required by the contractual obligation and related expense of the insurance subsidiary the actuary considers the adequacy of the statutory reserve in light of the asset held by the insurer with respect to such reserve and related actuarial item such the investment earnings on such asset and the consideration the insurer anticipates receiving and retaining under the related policy and contract we may increase reserve in order to submit such an opinion without qualification our insurance subsidiary that must provide these opinion have done so without qualification since this requirement began many of our non insurance operation must also analyze the adequacy of their statutory reserve in most of those case locally qualified actuary must submit an analysis of the likelihood that the reserve make adequate provision for the insurer associated contractual obligation and related expense regulatory and actuarial analytic standard vary widely national association of insurance commissionersthe naic assist state insurance regulatory authority to serve the public interest and achieve their regulatory goal state insurance regulator may act independently or adopt regulation proposed by the naic state insurance regulator and the naic regularly re examine existing insurance law and regulation state insurance regulator establish standard and best practice conduct peer review and coordinate their regulatory oversight through the naic the naic also provides standardized insurance industry accounting and reporting guidance through it accounting practice and procedure manual the manual which state have largely adopted by regulation however individual state establish statutory accounting principle which may differ from the manual change to the manual or modification by the various state insurance department may affect the statutory capital and surplus of metlife inc insurance subsidiary state insurance holding company law and regulation are generally based on the naic insurance holding company system regulatory act and regulation model holding company act and regulation these vary from jurisdiction to jurisdiction but generally require controlled insurance company insurer that are subsidiary of insurance holding company to register and file report with state regulatory authority on it capital structure ownership financial condition intercompany transaction and general business operation state holding company law require the ultimate controlling person of insurer to file an annual enterprise risk report with the lead state of the insurance holding company system this report identifies risk likely to have material adverse effect upon the financial condition or liquidity of the insurer or it insurance holding company system whole each of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state ha enacted law to implement these requirement including the enterprise risk reporting requirement the holding company law also authorize state insurance commissioner to act global group wide supervisor for internationally active insurance group iaigs well other insurer that choose to opt in for group wide supervision these law provide confidentiality protection for communication with the group wide supervisor all state have adopted law and regulation enhancing group wide supervision in the nydfs amended it law to permit the new york superintendent of financial service superintendent to act group wide supervisor for iaigs in furtherance of the naic solvency modernization initiative the naic ha updated model act and regulation to address insurance company financial regulation discussed below and in particular capital requirement corporate governance and risk management practice group supervision liquidity stress testing statutory accounting and financial reporting and reinsurance the naic corporate governance annual disclosure model act which all state have adopted requires insurer to annually file detailed information regarding their corporate governance policy all state have also adopted the naic risk management and own risk and solvency assessment model act which requires insurer to maintain risk management framework and to document an internal own risk and solvency assessment orsa of it material risk in normal and stressed environment metlife inc ha submitted on behalf of the enterprise an orsa summary report to the nydfs annually since this requirement became effective the naic ha also approved valuation manual containing principle based approach to the calculation of life insurance reserve the valuation manual principle based reserving pbr is designed to better address reserving for life insurance and annuity product and it ha been adopted by all of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state the nydfs promulgated regulation in that affirms the superintendent authority to deviate from the valuation manual to adjust the reserve of new york domestic life insurance company such mlic if the nydfs determines that an alternative requirement would be in the best interest of new york policyholder of contentsthe naic ha been focused on macro prudential initiative since which is intended to enhance risk identification effort by building on the state based regulation system in furtherance of this initiative the naic adopted change to it statutory annual statement reporting effective for year end to improve liquidity risk monitoring the naic also adopted amendment to the model holding company act and regulation that implement requirement related to liquidity stress testing framework for certain large life insurer and insurance group the applicability of the framework is based on amount of certain type of business written or material exposure to certain investment transaction such derivative and security lending the framework is consistent with metlife liquidity risk policy and procedure and is expected to have no impact on metlife of january the holding company amendment have been adopted by multiple state including six of our domiciliary state and they are expected to be broadly adopted in the future we use capital market solution to finance portion of our statutory reserve requirement for several product these include level premium term life product subject to the naic valuation of life insurance policy model regulation commonly referred to regulation xxx universal and variable life policy with secondary guarantee ulsg subject to naic actuarial guideline commonly referred to guideline axxx and mlic closed block in order to address the use of captive for policy covered by regulation xxx and guideline axxx the naic adopted actuarial guideline ag this guideline ha enhanced the statutory financial statement disclosure of an insurer use of captive and ha narrowed the type of asset permitted to back statutory reserve that are required to support the insurer future obligation ag also requires the actuary of ceding insurer to opine on the assuming insurer collateral associated with the treaty and to issue qualified opinion if the assuming entity is not complying with the requirement of ag the naic term and universal life insurance reserve financing model regulation codifies the same substantive requirement ag amended by the naic in and establishes uniform national standard governing reserve financing arrangement pertaining to the term life and universal life insurance policy with secondary guarantee the model regulation became an naic accreditation standard on september with enforcement beginning on january although state can use ag to satisfy the accreditation requirement we can not predict the capital and reserve impact compliance cost or other effect these initiative will have on our business financial condition or result of operation surplus and capitalinsurers must maintain their capital and surplus at or minimum level prescribed by the law of their respective jurisdiction regulator generally have discretionary authority to limit or prohibit an insurer sale to policyholder if the insurer ha not maintained minimum surplus or capital or if they find that the further transaction of business would be hazardous to policyholder state insurance statute also typically restrict the dividend or other distribution an insurance company subsidiary may pay to it parent company and limit the transaction between an insurer and it affiliate dividend in excess of prescribed limit and transaction above specified size between an insurer and it affiliate require the approval of the insurance regulator in the insurer state of domicile see management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation liquidity and capital resource metlife inc liquidity and capital source dividend from subsidiary see also dividend restriction in note of the note to the consolidated financial statement for further information regarding such limitation non jurisdiction also restrict the amount of such dividend and other distribution for example portion of the annual earnings of our japan operation may be repatriated each year and may further be distributed to metlife inc dividend we may determine not to repatriate profit from the japan operation or to repatriate reduced amount in order to maintain or improve the solvency of the japan operation or for other reason in addition the financial service agency in japan fsa may limit or not permit profit repatriation or other transfer of fund to the if such transfer would be detrimental to the solvency or financial strength of our japan operation or for other reason for development that could affect our ratio of free cash flow to adjusted earnings result and thus our surplus and capital see risk factor of contentsrisk based capitalmost of our insurance subsidiary are subject to risk based capital rbc requirement developed by the naic and adopted by their respective domiciliary state insurer calculate rbc annually based on formula that applies factor to various asset premium claim expense and statutory reserve item taking into account asset insurance interest rate and market and business risk characteristic regulator use the formula an early warning tool to identify insurer that may be inadequately capitalized for purpose of initiating regulatory action and not mean to rank insurer generally state insurance law provide insurance regulator the authority to require various action by or take various action against insurer whose total adjusted capital doe not meet or exceed certain rbc level of the date of the most recent annual statutory financial statement filed with insurance regulator the total adjusted capital of each of our subsidiary subject to these requirement wa in excess of each of these rbc level see statutory equity and income in note of the note to the consolidated financial statement and management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation liquidity and capital resource the company capital statutory capital and dividend the nydfs issue annual letter on special consideration each an scl to new york licensed insurance company including mlic that affect year end asset adequacy testing an scl could mandate assumption change that would require to increase or influence our decision to release certain asset adequacy reserve which could materially impact our statutory capital and surplus no change were made to our asset adequacy reserve in either or result of the scl see statutory equity and income in note of the note to the consolidated financial statement we calculate our internally defined statement based combined rbc ratio by dividing the sum of total adjusted capital for metlife inc principal insurance subsidiary excluding american life insurance company american life by the sum of company action level rbc for such subsidiary including scl consideration our statement based combined rbc ratio wa in excess of and in excess of at december and respectively by contrast we calculate an naic based combined rbc ratio based on such subsidiary statutory based filed financial statement and naic capital and reserving standard this naic based combined rbc ratio wa in excess of and in excess of at december and respectively we are not aware of any upcoming naic adoption or state insurance department regulation change that would have material impact on our naic based combined rbc ratio the naic adopted revision to certain factor used to calculate life rbc which is the denominator of the rbc ratio in light of change to tax law in recent year these revision have resulted in increased rbc charge and reduced our rbc ratio the naic ha approved rbc revision for corporate bond real estate equity and longevity risk that took effect at year end which modest net positive rbc impact on the naic ha also approved an rbc update for mortality risk that took effect at year end which had modest positive impact on our reported rbc ratio the naic developed group capital calculation gcc tool using an rbc aggregation methodology for all entity within an insurance holding company system including non entity the naic amended the model holding company act and regulation to adopt the gcc template and instruction and to implement the annual gcc filing requirement with an insurance group lead state regulator the filing requirement becomes effective when the holding company act amendment are adopted by the state where an insurance group lead state regulator is located bill is pending in the new york state legislature to adopt such amendment we can not predict impact this regulatory tool may have on our business solvency regimesour insurance business throughout the eea is subject to the solvency ii directive and it implementing rule these cover the capital adequacy risk management and regulatory reporting for insurer and reinsurers solvency ii harmonizes insurance regulation across the european union eu each eea member state ha transposed the solvency ii directive into it regulatory architecture it capital requirement are forward looking and based on the risk profile of each individual insurance company in order to promote comparability transparency and competitiveness in line with the requirement impacted metlife entity calculate and report their solvency capital requirement using standard formula prescribed by the solvency ii directive and further regulation by the european commission of contentsthe ceased to be member of the eu in january and is no longer subject to eu law while discussion continue between the and the eu on memorandum of understanding mou for financial service there is no clear timeline for completion in the meantime the government ha begun the process of reviewing it regulatory framework it is likely that the domestic prudential regime may begin to diverge from the solvency ii directive but it is still unclear if it will do so in way that would prevent future mou or have material impact on the supervision of insurer similarly the eu institution have undertaken their own review of solvency ii the european commission and the european council have developed position and are awaiting the parliament report to start trialogue negotiation the full extent of the change will only be known once the package of legislative reform is finalized we do not expect any change to solvency ii resulting from this legislative process to be finalized and transposed into eea member state respective domestic legislation prior to mexico ha adopted solvency ii type regulatory framework which imposes reserve and capital requirement and corporate governance to foster transparency in line with the requirement of the local solvency ii insurance company calculate and report their capital requirement using standard formula designed by the local regulator cnsf in addition required certain metlife entity must submit annual orsa report to the cnsf on an ongoing basis in chile the law implementing solvency ii like regulation continues in the study stage the implementation date for the new solvency regime ha not yet been set however it could be in force within four year after the final regulation is published metlife chile implemented governance change and risk policy to comply with prior regulatory change metlife chile also submitted it orsa regular report to the regulator in june the superintendence of private insurance the brazilian insurance regulator ha established an insurance framework for minimum capital requirement based on risk criterion for investment activity formal risk management function and formal enterprise risk management framework metlife brazil ha formalized the designation of local risk manager and implemented governance structure and risk management framework component in accordance with local regulatory requirement japanese law requires insurer to maintain solvency standard to protect policyholder and to support their own financial strength most japanese life insurer maintain solvency margin ratio well in excess of the legally mandated minimum in addition we expect japan to adopt an economic value based solvency regime in in china the business of our joint venture well the industry ha implemented china risk oriented solvency system ross risk based solvency regime like solvency ii ross focus on risk management and ha three pillar strengthen quantitative capital requirement enhance qualitative supervision and establish governance and market discipline process on december the china banking and insurance regulatory commission cbirc issued the regulatory rule for the solvency of insurance company ii rule ii marking completion of the buildout of ross phase ii cbirc will determine transition period policy based on actual circumstance allowing for step by step implementation of some of the regulatory rule with full implementation to be in place by no later than our joint venture will continue strengthening it solvency management in accordance with the revised rule the korea financial supervisory service implemented new solvency system the korean insurance capital standard in january this system reflects the international association of insurance supervisor iais global insurance capital standard and incorporates certain product portfolio and other feature specific to the korean market and includes mark to market valuation iaisthe iais is voluntary membership association of insurance supervisor and regulator it is the global standard setting body responsible for developing and assisting in the implementation of principle standard and guidance well supporting material for the supervision of the insurance sector the iais is member of the financial stability board fsb an international entity established to coordinate develop and promote regulatory supervisory and other financial sector policy in the interest of financial stability the iais participates in the fsb initiative to identify and manage systemic risk globally the iais ha adopted holistic framework for the assessment and mitigation of systemic risk in the global insurance sector the holistic framework the framework monitor the build up of vulnerability at jurisdictional and global level to address any such risk through the application of enhanced supervisory measure based on existing insurance core principle and the common framework for supervision of iaigs in december the fsb endorsed the holistic framework and discontinued the designation of globally systemically important insurer an iais proposal becomes effective when it is enacted through legislation or regulation in the applicable jurisdiction metlife inc is not non bank sifi the impact on metlife inc of the iais global proposal is uncertain of contentsdiversity and corporate governancethe naic and state insurance regulator are evaluating issue related to diversity within the insurance industry in new york the nydfs expects the insurer it regulates to make diversity of their leadership business priority and key element of their corporate governance the nydfs collected data from insurer that met certain new york premium threshold including metlife inc and certain of it subsidiary regarding the diversity of their corporate board and management the nydfs plan to publish such data on an aggregate basis to measure progress in the industry and it now includes diversity related question in it examination process the naic is also evaluating issue related to race diversity and inclusion and it is examining practice in the insurance industry in order to determine how barrier are created that disadvantage people of color or historically underrepresented group new york insurance regulation regulation establishes standard for the determination and any readjustment of non guaranteed element nges that may vary at the insurer discretion for life insurance policy and annuity contract delivered or issued for delivery in new york nges include cost of insurance for universal life insurance policy well interest crediting rate for annuity and universal life insurance policy the regulation requires insurer to notify policyholder at least day in advance of any change in nges that is adverse to policyholder and with respect to life insurance to notify the nydfs at least day prior to any such change the regulation also requires insurer to inform the nydfs annually of any change adverse to policyholder made in the prior year the regulation generally prohibits insurer from increasing profit margin for in force policy or adjusting nges in order to recoup past loss cybersecurity privacy and data protection regulationwe are subject to variety of law and regulation at the local state federal and international level regarding the collection storage use retrieval processing disclosure protection and security of personal information including health related and customer information and employee data various local state and federal law in the and around the world require company such ours to inform consumer of data collection storage and processing practice and further dictate whether how and under what circumstance we may transfer process or receive personal information the interpretation and scope of which are constantly evolving and vary significantly from jurisdiction to jurisdiction we are also subject to law and regulation governing the security and integrity of our information system and the non public information stored therein many of which require the implementation and maintenance of comprehensive information security program and require notification to affected individual and regulator of security breach and other cyber incident given growing cybersecurity risk and threat posed to information and financial system by nation state terrorist organization and independent criminal actor in recent year insurance and other regulator have increased focus on cybersecurity practice and regulatory and legislative activity in the area of privacy data protection and cybersecurity continues to increase worldwide below we highlight some of the key data protection and cybersecurity law and regulation to which we are subject of contentscybersecuritythe nydfs promulgated the new york cybersecurity requirement for financial service company the regulation to promote the protection of customer information and information technology system by establishing and regulating cybersecurity requirement for banking and insurance entity under the nydfs jurisdiction in general the regulation requires covered entity such our insurance entity licensed in new york to ass risk associated with their information system and establish and maintain cybersecurity program designed to ass those risk and protect the confidentiality integrity and availability of such system and data specifically the regulation provides for among other thing technical safeguard and control relating to the governance framework for cybersecurity program ii risk based policy procedure and minimum standard for technology system for data protection iii minimum standard for cyber breach response including notice to the nydfs of certain material event iv designation of chief information security officer and other qualified cybersecurity personnel oversight of third party service provider with access to the information system and nonpublic personal information of covered entity including via implementation of written policy and procedure to evaluate the third party service provider cybersecurity practice and vi identification and documentation of material deficiency remediation plan and annual certification of regulatory compliance the nydfs ha proposed amendment to the regulation which if adopted would require the implementation of new reporting governance and oversight measure and enhanced cybersecurity safeguard such annual audit vulnerability assessment and password control and monitoring and mandate notification in the event covered entity make cyber ransom payment we can not predict whether the amendment will be adopted what form they will take or what effect they would have on our business or compliance cost covered entity that fail to comply with the regulation may be subject to enforcement action brought by the nydfs the result of which could lead to civil penalty and other legal and reputational cost the naic adopted the insurance data security model law the cybersecurity model law which requires insurer and other entity licensed by state insurance department to develop implement and maintain risk based information security program the cybersecurity model law also establishes standard for data security and for investigation of and notification to insurance commissioner of cybersecurity event involving unauthorized access to or the misuse of certain nonpublic information several state have adopted the cybersecurity model law including four of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state and more may adopt it in the future requiring further compliance and oversight effort such compliance effort may present an increasing demand on our system and resource and require significant new and ongoing investment including investment in compliance process personnel and technical infrastructure on may president biden signed executive order on improving the nation cybersecurity the order to strengthen the federal government cybersecurity defense and that of it vendor the office of management and budget omb ha released several memoranda expounding on various aspect of the order for example omb released the federal government strategy to move towards zero trust cybersecurity principle on january while metlife provides employee benefit to several of the agency that are subject to the order it is not directly subject to the new requirement at this time based on the scope of the order while the order is primarily aimed at technology and software provider and supplier there are effort underway within whole of government approach to combat cyber attack and ransomware attack which could potentially impose additional cybersecurity requirement on metlife and other federal contractor over time of contentsprivacy and data protectionin the we are subject to state law which impose certain obligation on the processing of personal information and provide consumer specific right to control their personal information for instance the california consumer privacy act ccpa which applies to certain portion of our business requires covered company to provide disclosure to california consumer about such company data collection use and sharing practice and give california resident expanded right with respect to the processing of their personal information in november the ccpa wa amended by the california privacy right act cpra which took effect in most material respect on january the cpra expands the ccpa including with respect to the processing of certain sensitive personal information and establishes regulatory agency the california privacy protection agency cppa to promulgate rule and regulation and to enforce those requirement regulator may impose fine for violation and individual have private right of action for the unauthorized disclosure of personal information result of failure to maintain reasonable security procedure ccpa enforcement thus far ha been limited it ha not been subject to significant litigation and judicial interpretation and the cpra ha shifted enforcement duty from the state attorney general to the new cppa result it remains unclear how various provision of the ccpa will be interpreted and enforced moreover in february the cppa adopted it final rule change to the ccpa regulation these are expected to come into force in april while significant portion of our business is exempted from the ccpa specific requirement the health insurance portability and accountability act and the insurance law of several state to which we are subject grant similar right to insured including the right to request copy of their personal information that company ha collected several other state either have proposed or adopted new comprehensive privacy law which may apply to certain portion of our business however some of these state law such those enacted in virginia colorado and utah include broad entity wide exemption for financial institution additionally draft of new federal privacy bill the american data privacy and protection act adppa wa introduced in june with the aim of harmonizing and improving federal data protection legislation the adppa wa not enacted during the last congress but it or similar federal legislation may be enacted in the future adapting our practice to comply with new law and regulation may increase compliance cost and potentially change our business practice outside of the our subsidiary are subject to various data protection regime including the general data protection regulation eu gdpr which became effective on may and applies to entity established in the eu well to entity not established in the eu that target good or service to eu data subject or that monitor consumer behavior that take place in the eu the gdpr imposes strict requirement for controller and processor of personal data including for example by requiring detailed disclosure to data subject mechanism for individual to access and correct personal data specific timeline for data breach notification limitation on retention of information and stringent limit pertaining to the collection and storage of special category of personal data such health information and highly specific obligation when contracting with third party processor in connection with the processing of eu personal data the gdpr also imposes strict requirement on transfer of personal data outside of the eea to country which have not been deemed adequate by the european commission in this regard the ha been deemed adequate and the ha not been deemed adequate however the and european commission have announced an agreement in principle on an eu data transfer framework while the gdpr provides more harmonized approach to data protection regulation across the eu member state it also give eu member state certain area of discretion and therefore law and regulation in relation to certain data processing activity may differ on member state by member state basis which could further limit our data collection and processing ability and could require localized change to our operating model relatedly following the exit from the eu data privacy law in the includes the gdpr retained in law by virtue of the european union withdrawal act and the data protection act of both amended by the data protection privacy and electronic communication amendment etc eu exit regulation together gdpr the interpretation of the gdpr may eventually start to differ from the gdpr and ensuring compliance with each is and will remain an ongoing commitment that involves substantial cost we are also increasingly subject to increasingly restrictive law in other jurisdiction that address and impose strict requirement on cross border data transfer including for example the people republic of china personal information protection law and brazil general data protection law the above law and other similar law that may be passed may require to adapt our practice and divert resource from other initiative and project to address such evolving compliance and operational requirement moreover despite our effort governmental authority or others may assert that our business practice fail to comply with such requirement and if we are found to violate any such law we may incur substantial fine or damage have to change our business practice or face reputational harm any of which could have an adverse effect on our business of contentserisa fiduciary consideration and other pension and retirement regulationwe provide product and service to certain employee benefit plan that are subject to erisa and or section of the internal revenue code of amended the code erisa and the code impose restriction including fiduciary duty to perform solely in the interest of erisa plan participant and beneficiary and to avoid prohibited non exempt transaction the applicable provision of erisa and the code are subject to enforcement by the department of labor the dol the internal revenue service irs and the pension benefit guaranty corporation the prohibited transaction rule of erisa and the code generally restrict the provision of investment advice to erisa plan and participant and to individual retirement account ira and certain other arrangement if the investment recommendation result in fee paid to an individual advisor the firm that employ the advisor or their affiliate that vary according to the investment recommendation chosen unless an exemption or exception is available similarly without an exemption or exception fiduciary advisor are prohibited from receiving compensation from third party in connection with their advice erisa also affect certain of our in force insurance policy and annuity contract well insurance policy and annuity contract we may sell in the future the sec adopted regulation best interest in and compliance wa required beginning on june regulation best interest requires broker dealer to act in the best interest of individual investor retail customer when recommending account type security transaction or investment strategy involving security including recommendation to ira owner well non benefit plan retail customer in addition other sec rule require broker dealer and investment adviser to retail customer to describe their service and conflict of interest to their retail customer in client relationship summary disclosure and deliver copy to their retail customer in december the dol released the final version of the prohibited transaction exemption pte to allow investment advice fiduciary to receive compensation without violating erisa subject to impartial conduct standard and disclosure obligation aligned with the new sec rule in the preamble to pte the dol also provided it interpretation of the five part test used to determine whether person is acting an erisa investment advice fiduciary pte became effective on february in april the dol published additional guidance indicating that it may amend or add to this rule finra rule similarly impose know customer and suitability requirement on broker dealer well supplemental rule relating to sale of variable annuity including with respect to certain benefit plan customer and ira owner state regulator and legislature in nevada new jersey maryland and new york have proposed measure that would make broker dealer sale agent and investment adviser and their representative subject to fiduciary duty when providing product and service to customer including pension plan and ira and massachusetts ha enacted law to that effect the nydfs annuity suitability regulation incorporates the best interest standard and expands the scope of the regulation beyond annuity transaction to include sale of life insurance policy to consumer in april the appellate division of the new york supreme court overturned the regulation for unconstitutionally vague although the new york state court of appeal reversed this ruling on october regulation best interest under the security exchange act of amended exchange act doe not include private right of action although the sec did not indicate an intent to pre empt state regulation in this area and some of the state proposal and adopted regulation would allow for private right of action result of these development it is possible that it may become more costly to provide our product and service in the state subject to the new rule the secure act of secure signed into law on december make significant change to existing law for retirement plan by building upon provision in the setting every community up for retirement enhancement act of secure introduces new requirement and consideration for plan sponsor that are intended to expand coverage increase saving preserve income and simplify plan rule and administrative procedure among other provision secure directs the dol to review it current interpretive bulletin regarding erisa plan sponsor selection of annuity provider for purpose of transferring plan sponsor benefit plan liability to such annuity provider such review could result in the dol imposition of new or different requirement on plan sponsor or on annuity provider such mlic and metropolitan tower life insurance company or could make such selection process more difficult for the party involved in the chilean congress approved two bill each of which allowed individual to withdraw up to of pension account or the account balance if it is below certain amount in april the chilean congress approved third bill allowing for additional withdrawal of pension fund which also required insurance company to advance payment of up to of the reserve allocated to customer annuity since then bill allowing additional withdrawal and second advance payment of annuity were rejected
